Reviews.Title: “efficient”
Reviews.Author: hzgmecklenburg
Reviews.Content: The Penta Hotel Berlin Köpenick is situated directly on the river Spree. There is a small marina directly "next door". Rather quiet, not much traffic noise. The house is clean and the personel friendly. If you don't mind them wearing jeans at work you have a hotel with all you need to feel comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Way out of the centre, OK for buisiness”
Reviews.Author: raff40035
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights whilst attending a conference, Modern, funky rooms with excellent food. I flew into Tegel, which is quite a distance away. However when the new Brandenberg airport opens in June it will be much closer. It is however still a distance away from the city centre. The hotel has a lovely location at the confluence of the Damme and Spree and opposite the Kopenick Castle. OK if you are on buisness , but if on a city visit its perhaps too far out of the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Christmas Market Stay”
Reviews.Author: juejosh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Penta during a Christmas Market Break which was booked through Qwerty travel; found a good deal offered on Travelzoo's weekly top 20 and phoned to book for us and our friends, however part way through the booking process they offered us a special deal that had just come up, as we were booking three rooms for 7 people; this was the 4 star Penta instead of the 3 star hotel we had seen in the offer. As there were only a few rooms available we had to decide on the sport, so took it. When we later got the booking confirmation and receipt we found that the hotel wasnt actually in central Berlin, but in Koepenick, an area on the outskirt of the city. We were a little disappointed and felt conned, as we were hoping to stay in the centre to be able to visit the many Christmas Markets with ease, and now we find that we will have to commute, not a big deal for most but our party consisted of myself, a wheelchair user, two young people with learning disabilities and a child with a sight impairment, so not the easiest of groups to get around with. The only saving grace was that it was closer to the airport that we were arriving into. Before our arrival we contacted the hotel directly to ask for suitable rooms for the party and the wheelchair user in particular, and this was no problem for them, they also helped with giving directions to the hotel from the airport, by public transport, with the best options for wheelchair access as this was different than the travel info given on their site. However on arrival we found a large mvp taxi, which could take us all plus the luggage and wheelchair. En route to the hotel the taxi driver told us lots about Berlin and Kopenick, (and the fact their Christmas market didnt start until the week after our stay). He also agreed to pick us up the next day and take us into Berlin central. Taxi cost from airport to hotel was 25e. On arrival at the hotel we were unable to check in immediately as some filming was taking place of the Queen of the World beauty pagent was staying there. We were however offered a free drink as compensation. Once the filming was finished we were checked in with a inter connecting room for the wheelchair double and twin, which was very useful. The triple room was accross the hall, but on same floor and within easy reach. Rooms were modern, comfortable, and had all that would be expected in a modern hotel. We decided to eat in the hotel that evening and found the food very tasty and service was good, although we had to ask to eat in the restaurant rather than the bar, where they were going to serve us; the bar tables were low and it would have been difficult to eat a full meal, rather than bar snack from. Price was reasonable for a hotel restaurant, and there were snack options too (the potato rossti with egg was delicious, huge and well worth the money). The next day we went into Berlin, and Peter the taxi driver, picked us up as arranged, took us in via a tourist route giving us a guided tour to the sights. For all of us it cost 30e inc tip! It was very good as we would have missed many things as we simply wouldnt have known we were there. The markets in Belin were great, and seemed to run into each other there were that many, we had a great time. The only other thing to say about the Penta was that for the duration of our stay the 'queens' acted like spoilt brats, and being anything but ladylike, they were like a pack of drunken football hooligans returning to their rooms in the early hours, running around the corridors, waking people, knocking on doors, some right some wrong, and general having a ball without a second thought for others staying in the hotel; obviously as there was publicity, the hotel pandered to them, and often parts of the hotel, bar or lift was out of use to the public as photo shoots or filming were taking place, and it did impact on our stay quite a lot, the initial free drink not being enough to compensate for the inconvenience, in any way. Would I stay again, possibly - but only after checking there were no special events planned that would impact my stay again, and checking that Peter our taxi driver, was still available to take take us into town and back - and factoring these costs into the saving to be had staying here as opposed to staying in the city itself.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a poor location. Not for a short berlin visit”
Reviews.Author: GPeto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect example what a total refurbishment can do to an old 80s building. The interior designer did an outstanding job and you can see that money was not spared. There are only 2 places you see that this is an old building. The elevator is still from the medieval times and the bathrooms look outdated. The hotel is a 4 star. The rooms are ok. No mini-bar thou so I would argue a bit with a 4 star rating here. the breakfast is AMAZING. German breakfasts in general are very good but this one is SUPERB. The lobby is so nice that actually hanging around there is fun in the evening. Prices are LOW Location is not the best. Its close to Schonefeld, the future BBI airport that will open in the summer. Its a nice area thou but surely not useful if you wanna visit berlin for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Hip luxury in a peaceful suburb.”
Reviews.Author: urban_nerdster
Reviews.Content: By far one of the nicest most interesting hotels I've stayed in. Most rooms have a great river view which means ere is some noise from the patio restaurant and bar, but I never found this too disturbing. There is a great fitness center. The decorations in the room in the lobby were fun. Location is ae bit out of the way, but it is walkable to an s-bahn. The town of koepenick is really cute and worth walking around. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Absoulute Gem !”
Reviews.Author: Dunfers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this place for 3 nights, it is a great place to stay and you can get into Berlin very easily on tram 68 and then then S bahn from Kopenick. If I could give 10 stars I would, the rooms and hotel decor have all been re vamped. It is really trendy and modern. ( they even have free Wii in the bar area) who ever is responsiblefor the refit of this hotel deserves major credit. It is amazing believe me and could not believe the value. Everything about this place is totally brilliant including the staff. If you are going to Berlin stay here, you will not be dissapointed and I will definately return Any questions please ask.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great value”
Reviews.Author: Slothman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Berlin marathon. Hotel rooms very nice, comfy and quiet despite the hotel being full. Buffet breakfast really good with a wide choice. Quiet town and picturesque location on the river. Staff friendly and helpful. Only problem was that the S bahn wasn't working properly all weekend meaning it took a good hour and a half to get into Mitte (central Berlin). If this was working properly it would have been ideal. Great value 4 star hotel. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Relax Hotel at Urban Fringe”
Reviews.Author: MikeKwan
Reviews.Content: The name of the hotel has been changed to PentaHotel Berlin Koepenick in April/May 2008. It is a very good riverside hotel to relax and enjoy the countryside beauty. Yet it is not far from the urban centre. Take a 5-minute walk and you can reach the S-Bahn station Spindlersfeld. The S-Bahn and U-Bahn systems will bring you to nearly everywhere of Berlin downtown within 40 minutes. The rooms are quite spacious and two-third of them have a partial river view. However, if you not lucky enough, like me, the one-third roadside rooms are little bit noisy. For given the competitive price (euro 60 per night with breakfast), I have no complaint. The breakfast is very good in Europe standard with some hot dishes. The restaurant is so nice and you can enjoy a beautiful yacht club and river view. Remeber to spend a half day in the town of Koepenick itself and you can experience the local culture. Small solar-energy boats for rent nearby which only costs euro 10 per hour. The hotel is quite distanced from Tegel Airport - taxi euro 35 but it is very close to Schonefeld Airport - less than 1 hour S-Bahn connection.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for the airport”
Reviews.Author: Lutzi1
Reviews.Content: A pleasant stay and good value for money - we got a very good deal by shopping around on the internet. The room wasn't huge but it was comfortable enough,and the manager was extremely pleasant and helpful. When we got there they hadn't received our booking form the internet site we booked through, but he was very relaxed about it and it was all soon sorted out. He also booked us a mini bus taxi to Schoenefeld airport the next morning - for six of us, about 20 euros. Be warned, you will need to get a taxi from Koepenick station to the hotel, but it will only cost a few euros (ie less than 10) Koepenick itself was a pleasant little place to wander round, with several restaurants to choose from if you don't want to eat in the hotel. We did, and the food was delicious. The breakfast buffet was quite adequate - no comparison to the one at the Holiday Inn Schoenefeld, but then on the deal we got here, the Holiday Inn cost quite a bit more ( though their shuttle to the airport or station is free). Then again, there aren't many scenic delights to stroll round at Schoenefeld airport, so it all depends what you are looking for. As for some of the other reviews, I am baffled by people who apear internet savvy but who moan about the location of their accommodation and mark it down accordingly. Surely you would check the location on the internet before you booked it ??? Like most capital cities, Berlin is a big place, and what's handy for the airport is not going to be right next to all the sights. Is it just me ??

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, definately not in the city center”
Reviews.Author: DutchyCan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in April. Room was okay (we have had better ones in a Courtyard). It is spacious, but the furniture does not look that attractive. The hotel is big. There are busses and trams very closeby with which we went to the U- and S-Bahn to get to the city center. That will take you about 30 minutes in total. Like that you can see parts of the city too... Since we stayed 2 more days in Berlin, but in the more centrally located Marriott hotel, we found it not that troublesome to use public transport here. The breakfast was ok. The staff was nice and friendly. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: veggietraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in April and loved this hotel on the River Spree. Staff could not have been more helpful and welcoming. Breakfast above average. We liked being out of the city centre although we were just getting used to the S-bahn and U-bahn system for this surburban station by the time we were leaving. We are over 60 years of age and so received a discount. We found people in the hotel and generally in Berlin so nice, friendly and helpful although our German language skills are limited. For our last day we wanted to book a package of river cruise, candlelit dinner and concert in the Orangery at the Schloss Charlottenburg and the hotel staff booked this for us. I can't recommend this hotel enough so long as you don't mind being out of the city centre. Travelling to and fro was not long but, because Koepenick is on a branch line, the timetable was slightly difficult to follow. We would definitely go back. Koepenick has nice places to eat in as well as at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Very Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: NehaHarish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard Mariott for 3 night in March. The hotel was great and the service was good, with friendly staff always willing to help. However, the location of the hotel was in the middle of nowhere. The main city centre was about an hour away (sometimes longer depending on the trains) from the hotel. Although there is a train station within 5-7 mins walking distance, the train runs every 20 mins and is always on time. But what we found was that it took forever to get into town and we spend nearly 3 hours a day travelling into town and back. This hotel is more suitable for business people who can afford to pay for cabs! For tourists like us, its not a good location. There are many hotels in the city centre. So do check the tube map before booking. The breakfast was poor for vegetarians. No hot breakfast apart from potatoes,the rest is all for meat eaters. So all we had was just bread and yogurt. Overall not a bad hotel, apart from hotel location and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base on a family budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked through internet as a base for my return trip to Berlin after approx 30 years but this time with wife and 4 children. We had 2 ajoining rooms with plenty of space, very clean, very modern, needed and recieved more pillows - it was all very efficient. Inclusive breakfast was a joy, so much to choose from and such a treat to eat outside overlooking the river, kids loved it. Hotel staff very curteous, polite, helpful and always wanting to speak English even if we tried to speak a little German! Location might put people off but once we knew the timetable for S-Bahn it was only a few minutes to walk to the station and off to the centre for sightseeing/sports/food etc. Walk across the bridge and lo and behold its like a small village town centre with some shops, trams and restaurants. I loved coming back to Berlin, I loved staying at the Courtyard and would return there as a base. Thank you easyJet and thank you Courtyard.
